dt: {bc}of or relating to the {a_link|execution} of the laws and the conduct of public and national affairs

{bc}belonging to the branch of government that is charged with such powers as diplomatic representation, superintendence of the execution of the laws, and appointment of officials and that usually has some power over legislation (as through veto) {dx}compare {dxt|judicial||}, {dxt|legislative||}{/dx}
{bc}designed for or relating to execution or carrying into effect

shortdef: of or relating to the execution of the laws and the conduct of public and national affairs

belonging to the branch of government that is charged with such powers as diplomatic representation, superintendence of the execution of the laws, and appointment of officials and that usually has some power over legislation (as through veto)
designed for or relating to execution or carrying into effect

dt: {bc}the person or persons who constitute the executive magistracy of a state
{bc}a directing or controlling office of an organization
{bc}one that exercises administrative or managerial control

shortdef: the executive branch of a government; also : the person or persons who constitute the executive magistracy of a state
a directing or controlling office of an organization
one that exercises administrative or managerial control

dt: {bc}an agreement between the U.S. and a foreign government made by the executive branch either alone or with Congressional approval and dealing usually with routine matters

shortdef: an agreement between the U.S. and a foreign government made by the executive branch either alone or with Congressional approval and dealing usually with routine matters

dt: {bc}the head {d_link|chef|chef} of a professional kitchen or of a group of professional kitchens

dt.t: His résumé was filled with Connecticut restaurants … ; at Le Coq Hardi Restaurant in Stamford, he was, variously, … first cook, sous chef, and finally {wi}executive chef.{/wi}
Bala Kumanan, a French-trained chef, oversees the quality of the food … as the {wi}executive chef{/wi} of the high-end restaurants that span from Vancouver to Ottawa.

shortdef: the head chef of a professional kitchen or of a group of professional kitchens

dt: {bc}the ability to carry out goal-directed behavior using complex mental processes and cognitive abilities (such as {d_link|working memory|working memory} and impulse inhibition)

dt.t: … the prefrontal cortex, which is known to be involved in a range of high-level, {wi}executive control{/wi} processes …

shortdef: the ability to carry out goal-directed behavior using complex mental processes and cognitive abilities (such as working memory and impulse inhibition)

dt: {bc}a council constituted to advise or share in the functions of a political executive
{bc}a council that exercises supreme executive power

shortdef: a council constituted to advise or share in the functions of a political executive
a council that exercises supreme executive power

dt: {bc}the group of complex mental processes and cognitive abilities (such as {d_link|working memory|working memory}, impulse inhibition, and reasoning) that control the skills (such as organizing tasks, remembering details, managing time, and solving problems) required for goal-directed behavior

dt.t: The biggest impacts, she says, are in enhancing what's known as {wi}executive function{/wi}—the ability to perform complex tasks that rely on planning or decision making.
But a new study reports that soccer players actually have superior {wi}executive functions{/wi}, the brain processes responsible for planning and abstract thinking.

utxt.t: Measures of attention, hyperactivity, and {wi}executive functioning{/wi} (the ability to process feedback, interpret life's good and bad moments, and react in an appropriate way to events) were based on reports from parents and teachers …

shortdef: the group of complex mental processes and cognitive abilities (such as working memory, impulse inhibition, and reasoning) that control the skills (such as organizing tasks, remembering details, managing time, and solving problems) required for goal-directed behavior; also : one of these complex mental processes

dt: {bc}the officer second in command of a military or naval organization or vessel

shortdef: the officer second in command of a military or naval organization or vessel

dt: {bc}exemption from legally enforced disclosure of communications within the executive branch of government when such disclosure would adversely affect the functions and decision-making processes of the executive branch

shortdef: exemption from legally enforced disclosure of communications within the executive branch of government when such disclosure would adversely affect the functions and decision-making processes of the executive branch
